title: Stories from the Underside of the Idolatrous Projected Image
description:
Corey's worked in the Canadian correctional system for a number of years and has learned wisdom by looking at life from the bottom. He's currently working on becoming a counselor and pursuing a degree of psychology. Of course he found me by watching Jordan Peterson and so we swap stories.

Born in St. John
Grew up Roman Catholic, drifted
Second largest city geographically in Canada, lived in the country of the city
Cottage on a lake, no real neighbors around
Father was a projectionist, trailed along with him to the theater
Criminology degree, working at a jail
Prison reform
Working with human nature
Got a black belt in JBP, gotta pick a master, first master I submitted to
Trust levels goes down for people when you work in prisons
Do a masters degree in counseling psychology
Forced to sit
Trying to be brave enough to listen to something that before you wanted to brush off
To be open to what would challenge what you think
To be OK with not knowing
Feel like we're getting to a point when things are converging. 
Is this the UFC of ideas? Champions of thought? 
What are some of the things that challenge our faith?
I almost feel like I don't have a right to the ideas, that I haven't earned them
The Magic Schoolbus
Stories from the underside of the idolatrous projected image
Tools, techniques and philosophies
Rebel Wisdom
Never heard a sophisticated Christian before
The whole thing seemed to outdated. I had everything I needed to move forward
